result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Initial Appearance set for February 21, 2022 @ 9:00 am in Br 1
Letter from the Defendant in re:  request for bond modification (sent to C.M. in Br 2 on 01/20/22 sp)

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.
  Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License and   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol. 
  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge and Andrew Mutchler appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appears in court for defendant. 
ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 5th. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner requests a lower cash bond. 
BY THE COURT: Court sets bond.
